Crime_Name: Work Permit Refusal under Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer breached procedural fairness by failing to consider evidence of the applicant's English language training
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) and its Regulations
Outcome: Judicial review allowed; case remitted for reconsideration by a different officer
Procedural_Context: Judicial review based on procedural fairness
Evidence_Type: Documentation from CICEX showing English language training
Legal_Provision: Requirement to demonstrate sufficient language skills under IRPA
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to consider submitted language training documentation
Application_Error: Failure to assess or acknowledge relevant evidence of language training
Review_Outcome: Court found breach of procedural fairness
Evidence_Ignored: Documentation from CICEX regarding English training
Decision_Outcome: Work permit application denied due to perceived insufficient English skills
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness (implied by judicial review context)
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA and Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations â€“ language requirements and procedural fairness
Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections related to language proficiency and procedural fairness under IRPA and Regulations
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to evaluate submitted evidence of language training
Procedural_Fairness: Breach found due to failure to consider relevant evidence
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Allegation of procedural unfairness in assessment
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Procedural_Issue: Failure to afford procedural fairness during assessment
